result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Vanhammond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #16CF40-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to 10 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 6 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentences.

[Clerk's added note:  in making its findings that Mr. Vanhammond is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program in case #16CF40, the Court indicated its intent that Mr. Vanhammond will not become eligible for this programming until he will have already served 60% of the confinement time.]

[MK] cases #16CF40, #16CF68, #16CF72, #16CF78, #16CF84, #16CF244 called at 2:08pm. 
Defendant Matthew D Vanhammond in court, in custody,  with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; three victim impact statements are submitted.  
In Case #16CF244 Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment is held:  
--Mr. Vanhammond waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment. 
--Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived.  

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited. Pleas of "No Contest" are entered in Case #16CF40-Count 2, in Case #16CF72-Counts 1 & 3, in Case #16CF244-Counts 1 & 4 & 7; factual basis stipulated.
The Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Vanhammond guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses the remaining Counts in Cases #16CF72 and #16CF244, along with Case #16CF68, Case #16CF78, and Case #16CF84.  Further the Court reads-in an uncharged referral (Jefferson 16JE2281; JCSO 2016-22167) for 75 counts of Felony Bailjumping contrary to Statute 946.49(1)(b) with dates of violation on or between 7/12/16 and 8/6/16, and bars further prosecution of this referral.

During the Sentencing portion of the hearing case #16CF40 victim statements are made by Dee Jarlsberg and Norm Stanley;  and statements in support of the Defendant are made by Veronica Sanabria and by David Parsons. 


On Case #16CF40-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to 10 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 6 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentences.
The Court finds that Mr. Vanhammond is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 255 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no contact with Norm Stanley or Dee Jarlsberg
--no presence at Norm's Hideaway in the Town of Sumner
--to pay restitution of $9,785.11 to Norm Stanley
--to pay restitution of $8,640.61 to RAC Insurance 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or pursue an education program
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge and the restitution surcharge 
--------------------------------------------------------------

On Case #16CF72-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to  4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to Case #16CF40. 
On Case #16CF72-Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to  4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is concurrent to Count #1. 
The Court finds that Mr. Vanhammond is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision on both counts:
--no presence at Yerges Storage in the City of Fort Atkinson
--to pay restitution of $2,500 to Alexander Crowley
--to pay restitution of $6,126.55 to State Farm Insurance
--to pay the restitution processing fee
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling  as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or puruse as education program by the Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharges and the restitution surcharges 
--------------------------------------------------------------


On Case #16CF244-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to  4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to #16CF40 and #16CF72 and any other sentences 
On Case #16CF244-Count #4 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence concurrent to Count #1. 
The Court finds that Mr. Vanhammond is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0  days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no presence at Patten's Marine 
--no presence at the Fort Atkinson VFW 1879
--no contact with the Driftskipper's Snowmobile Club
--to make restitution of $4,705 to Mark Van Aacken
--to make resitution of $75 to Driftskipper's Snowmobile Club
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or pursue education program
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharges and the restitution surcharges 

On Case #16CF244-Count #7 the Court sentences Mr. Vanhammond to 9 months in Jail, without Huber, to be served in Prison, concurrent with Counts #1 & #4.
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges as to this count.

[Clerk's added note:  in making its findings that Mr. Vanhammond is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" and for the Substance Abuse Program in case #16CF40, the Court indicated its intent that Mr. Vanhammond will not become eligible for this programming until he will have already served 60% of the confinement time.]

Preliminary hearing at 02-12-2016 08:30 am

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf] {Judge Koschnick presiding for Br. 2}
Defendant Matthew D Vanhammond in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Attorney Svehlek advises that she has not completed an evaluation yet, she will do so after today's hearing. She informs the Court if the defendant is not eligible she will provide the defendant with the petition for court appointed attorney.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Court requires a $1,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact with Co- Defendant Michael Thorpe, Veronica Sanabria, Norman Stanley, Dee Jarlsberg, Charles Hield or Jessica Hield
-No presence at  Norm's Hideaway

Preliminary Hearing requested within the 10 day time limit requested by the defense, Attorney Svehlek and Attorney Flint agree to extend time limits by 2 days.

Recess:  1:28 pm
NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing on 2/12/16 at 8:30 am- Send notices
